sentences.sContent: His failure to turn his attention to flagrant wastes of public money is inexcusable.
sentences.sContent_eng: His failure to turn his attention to flagrant wastes of public money is inexcusable.
sentences.sCn: 他未能注意到公共资金的公然浪费，这是不可原谅的。

sentences.sContent: In a world flagrant with the failures of civilization, what is there particularly immortal about our own?~G. K. Chesterton.
sentences.sContent_eng: In a world flagrant with the failures of civilization, what is there particularly immortal about our own?~G. K. Chesterton.
sentences.sCn: 在一个世界公然与文明的失败，有什么特别的不朽的自己?~G.K。切斯特顿。

synos.tran: 公然的；不能容忍的；非常的；恶名昭著的（名词flagrancy，副词flagrantly）

remMethod.val: 不要和fragrant(adj. 芳香的)相混

words.tran: 千真万确地；罪大恶极地

trans.tranCn: 罪恶昭彰的； 公然的
trans.tranOther: a flagrant action is shocking because it is done in a way that is easily noticed and shows no respect for laws, truth etc
